group_1.textLeft: Mitama has another strange project@underway, then...
Some things never change, and her penchant@for mayhem is one of them.

group_1.textRight: So what happened next?
Did you get involved in more of that@"new couple" project?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah.
But then a bunch of customers arrived@at the shop and we had to move on.

group_1.textRight: Puella Care moved onto another town,
so Mitama's shop is getting a lot of business.

group_1.textLeft: Mitama must be really happy about that,@but I bet she's overwhelmed, too.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, last time I went over,@she looked completely wiped.
I'm glad everyone's having fun, though.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah.
Being able to enjoy these happy days@and dream about the future…
This is what we've been striving for all along.@Everyone has been saved,
so even when things get hectic...@I feel relieved, too.

group_1.textRight: Speaking of relief, didn't you catch a break@recently, Mifuyu?

group_1.textLeft: What do you mean?

group_1.textRight: Yes, that's right!
I got an A on my entry exam!

group_1.textLeft: All of those study sessions with Touka@are paying off.

group_1.textRight: Yes! Just as I promised, it looks like I'll enroll@in pharmacy school and become independent.
But still...

group_1.textLeft: Hm? Is something wrong?

group_1.textRight: No, nothing's wrong… I just…@I wish I could tell Kanae and Mel, too.

group_1.textLeft: ...If they were still with us, I'm sure they would@have been overjoyed.

group_1.textRight: If they were still with us...yes...
...I keep thinking about them.
Our happiness now makes me feel guilty.@I wish I could go back in time, and...
...Do you ever feel that way, Yacchan?

group_1.textLeft: I think everyone does, not just us.
We suffered many losses in that final battle...
...It's only natural to feel sad and cling@to the past.
Don't you feel the same, Tsuruno?

group_1.textRight: I don't know...
The old days were when I was pushing myself@way too hard, so it's hard to say.
But Mikazuki has changed a lot compared@to what it used to be.
I often think back to our days with Mel, too.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, that's what I mean.
I often go back to the time when my grandma@ran the boarding house here.

group_1.textRight: Oh, those were the days.
I was so happy back then,
being doted upon by the college girls and@celebrating with your grandmother...

group_1.textLeft: Yes...

group_1.textRight: I get it. There's good things both now and@in the past,
like when I lived with Mom and Dad.

group_1.textLeft: I don't have any good memories of the past.@I'm much happier now.
But I think I was loved back when I was still@really little.

group_1.textRight: In a way, I sort of miss my time@in the hospital, too.

group_1.textLeft: Were you happy then?

group_1.textRight: Yeah. Even though I was really sick,@I was happy.
That's because I had you, Touka, and Nemu@with me.
How about you?

group_1.textLeft: I never really fit in at school...
I had some very dark days back then.
But when I got to visit you in the hospital,@when I lived with Mom and Dad,
and enjoyed happy days with you@and the others...
I see...
Maybe the kind of happiness we had back then@is different from now.
Our pasts hold more than just sadness.
They have happiness, however small,@scattered throughout, too.

group_1.textRight: Yeah.

group_1.textLeft: Oh wow, look at the time!
Yachiyo, we need to get dinner ready.

group_1.textRight: Sis...
Something's wrong...@Everyone stopped moving all of a sudden...

group_1.textLeft: No way...@You can't be serious.
Yachiyo! Tsuruno!
You're right, they just stopped moving out@of nowhere... What on earth is going on?

group_1.textCenter: ...At least the clock is still running.
